review_title: I like working here, but management  is disrespectful towards their employees.
pros: The job itself is hard work. very challenging.most of the staff are nice . the Doctors , nurses.
cons: The management. they lie to the staff a lot and they micro manage..I have lost my respect for them . I will do my job. talk to them when I need to .they have lied to me numerous times and other employees.they show a lot of favortisim.It seems like the ones that whine and dont do there jobs are the ones that get everything .. that is not far to the ones that work hard.. I had a good reputation at all my jobs have worked but this one has given nothing but negative.I always ask myself when does ever end..every time they talk.its a lie. the benefits used to be good . people are so disappointed.. I thinking about dropping mine and finding some on the outside..

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Noblesville, IN

review_title: Such potential, but clueless senior leadership
pros: Community focus; staff works well together; physicians are great for the most part; excellent facilities
cons: Senior leadership seemed bound and determined to thwart innovation and initiative. For a small organization that touts its "flat" organization chart....the chart may be flat but it is a mile wide and there is still a path to take. Financial issues have hit the organization in recent years. They seem to be trying to change, but it may be too late. I'm really not sure why they haven't joined with Community at this point.

pros: Family feeling, good quality of care, focus on quality, generous benefit package.  Small size gives opportunity for cross training and skills development.
cons: Many employees have worked there a long time, particularly in patient care areas.  What this means is they have no idea of how things work other places.  PTO was a huge issue, even though just about every other place has it., for example.  Any change, minor or major, is a huge deal.

pros: they have some good nurses & respiratory & doctors. I wish housekeeping wouldn't keep moving the housekeepers around. There is a new person all the time&its hard to keep up with the name changes.The decor looks really good! The cafe is doing better but ther are no cakes or pies anymore. I love the volunteers, they help sooo much!
cons: Some days we are short staff- mainly the techs!! Raises are cut alot the past few years & yes im happy to have a job but i have to eat too.

review_title: Riverview keeps employees happy and busy
pros: Empowering their employees and giving the employees the necessary tools to do their jobs.  Riverview has a very good benefits package and are interested in my development in my job.  The people are very friendly and made me feel very welcomed when I started working there.
cons: I have to wait 6 months before I can use PTO.  Limits choices of physicians to choose for medical care.

pros:
The workload was Very manageable and different each day which means it was never boring.
Decent pay - they were very fair with the hourly rate.
Friendly staff - you feel as if you are family.
Great doctors
cons: For me the biggest con was that it was forty five minutes from my home in good weather and longer during snow or rain.  The traffic was usually awful but seems a bit friendlier now that construction is done.  As with most places of employment you received a merit based increase which was typically about 3%.

pros:
Growth of facility
Explosion of many departments
Some loyal staff
Location of hospital
No mandated uniform color
Tuition reimbursement
Opportunity to transfer within hospital
cons: Riverview has expanded in many areas.  With growth has come lack of personal care.  It is no longer 'people caring for people'.

review_title: This was not a bad place to work but had a bit of the buddy system by which I felt some workers got preferential treatme
pros: Very clean work environment, Great nursing staff
cons: Some  departments  were ran using the good ole boy system which caused those out of the loop to feel left out.

review_title: inexperienced, selfish company to work, The pay is not competitive, corporate has no respect for the employees. Numbers.
pros: will work with you on days off. You get off at the same time each day.
cons: Pay is not competitive. Corporate doesn't give us what we need. It is a selfish one sided company. They would prefer to patch things up than fix them.

pros: Steady flow of work. Most problems are simple to resolve and as long as you have good communication skills you will excel at keeping your clients happy. Helping people is great, and to some people you're a lifesaver since you  know how to get their computer working or you can recover their lost data.
cons: Every job has cons, but you have to look for the best in it.

pros: Friendly people, all there for each other.  The staff and management are supportive of each other.  There is honesty and caring for staff and patients.  Quality of care is excellent also.
cons: There's a lot of competition in the area from larger hospitals and it's difficult to compete on pay sometimes.

pros: Great co-workers and great first line manager.
cons: First line manager was great - all others - sad. Upper managers constantly state they want input - but never do anything with the input. So the 'true' knowledgeable people just shut down - knowing upper mngt will do what they want.

review_title: Great place to work, great staff, patient focused
pros: Empowerment of management to allow staff to do what they do to meet patient needs.  Support of management to get the tools you need to assist with patient care.
cons: Some issues are not always fully addressed with higher management.

review_title: Slow moving administration but typical for a hospital.
